intro: Pentanisia variabilis var. intermedia, commonly known as the variable pentanisia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
